title: Goldman Sachs, Citi, Moelis ready funds for Ingenia raising
text:
Ingenia Communities Group is set to put a rights issue and placement to investors on Wednesday in an effort to raise about $130 million in fresh funds.

The company’s shares are in a trading halt and it is understood Ingenia has had stockbroker Goldman Sachs, Moelis and Citi securing early support.

Funds raised are pegged for a three lifestyle community assets and injecting capital into their joint venture with American Sun Communities.

The deal is expected is at $3.93 a share. The stock last closed at $4.05.

Ingenia, which operates both holiday and residential communities for downsizing baby boomers, is seeking fresh funds. Craig Sillitoe

The mooted deal comes four months after Ingenia Communities, which has a $961 million market cap, entered the funds management business with the $17 million acquisition of Eighth Gate Capital Management.
description: Ingenia Communities Group is set to put a rights issue and placement to investors on Wednesday.
